title: Patrick Vieira tipped for Arsenal return this summer to work with Arsene Wenger if boss signs new Gunners deal
text:
EFL PAT ON THE BACK Patrick Vieira tipped for Arsenal return this summer to work with Arsene Wenger if boss signs new Gunners deal 
Perry Groves believes Wenger is staying tight-lipped on his future because club want to make a double announcement By Alec Shilton Comments PATRICK VIEIRA is being tipped for a stunning return to Arsenal this summer. 
Gunners legend Perry Groves believes Arsene Wenger is staying tight-lipped on his future because the club want to make a double announcement. Getty Images 8 Patrick Vieira could make a return to Arsenal this summer 
Vieira recently came out in support of Wenger and claimed that Arsenal’s players are to blame for their season spiralling out of control. 
Keep up to date with all the latest news, gossip, rumours and done deals in SunSport’s live transfer blog 
The former France midfielder – a member of the ‘Invincibles’ who won three league titles and four FA Cups with the club – has previously admitted his frustration at Wenger’s reluctance to appoint him and fellow ex-Gunners to his coaching staff. 
But Groves, who netted 28 times in 203 appearances for Arsenal , reckons Vieira could be poised to ditch the reins at New York City and return to north London to work with Wenger. PA:Press Association Wenger appears set to stay at Arsenal despite recent results PA:Press Association Vieira was allowed to leave Arsenal and become a coach at Man City Arsene Wenger refuses to confirm about his decision to stay as manager at Arsenal Getty Images 8 Perry Groves reckons Vieira's return could be part of a double announcement 
He said: “I don’t why – if Arsene is clear in his own mind – he doesn’t let everyone know as soon as possible as it takes away the uncertainty and instability. 
“It just makes me wonder if there’s another announcement they’re going to make in conjunction with him saying that he’s going to say. 
“A change to the coaching staff, because it needs to be a bit more hands on. “I wouldn’t want to put a name to it, but if it’s a 6’4 dominant central midfield player who used to play for us and lead us by example, who has been coaching over in American and has decided he wants to come back - that sort of person. 
“Not mentioning any names though!" 
West Brom boss Tony Pulis claims Wenger told him he's staying after Baggies' 3-1 win over Arsenal earlier this month. AP:Associated Press 8 Vieira lifted three Premier League titles as a Gunners player 
And Groves reckons Wenger - who dodged questions over his future TEN times yesterday - will prove divisive for fans if he signs on. 
Speaking to Arseblog , the ex-Gunners striker added: “I actually think the longer it goes on, the more likely he is to sign a new contract. 
“Whether it’s a change in the coaching staff, whether they say they’re going to release a lot of funds for him to spend next year, because they know it’s going to be a split amongst Arsenal fans." Arsene Wenger protest goes ahead as two banners fly over the Hawthorns
